page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY 8
page.content:
During the 19th century Caergwrle, rather than Hope, seemed to benefit from the industrial explosion. The brewery created a new dynamic dimension to its{industry. }An 1871 O.S. map of the area showed the existence of a smithy, saw mill, sand pit, timber yard, flour mill and an old quarry in Caergwrle, reinforcing the abundance of resources available.
In terms of{religion}Hope still maintained its magnificant conventional church, but Caergwrle, in 1871, contained two Methodist and one Presbyterian chapels, emphasising the arrival of non-conformity. {(Local history)}
